action.content:
You are participating in a collaborative guessing game.
The goal is to find out whether this picture and another picture only I can see, are the same.
Please describe your image first. Then, I will provide my description and we can ask each other questions about the images to figure out whether they are the same. Now start your short image description with "DESCRIPTION:" followed by the description. Do not add anything else.

DESCRIPTION: The image consists of different colored geometric shapes. On the left, there is a tall, green, narrow rectangle with a purple cross shape beside it. In the center of the image, there is a series of orange steps resembling stairs. On the right, there is a pink cross shape with a white square and a green vertical rectangular structure behind it.

You are participating in a collaborative guessing game.
The goal is to find out whether this picture and another picture only I can see, are the same.
Please describe your image first. Then, I will provide my description and we can ask each other questions about the images to figure out whether they are the same. Now start your short image description with "DESCRIPTION:" followed by the description. Do not add anything else.

DESCRIPTION: The image shows several tetrominoes (four connected squares forming a geometric shape). There is one purple plus shape, three green T-shaped pieces, one orange L-shaped piece which is partially complete, and two pink pieces; one is upside-down T-shaped and the other is a single square.

This is my DESCRIPTION: The image consists of different colored geometric shapes. On the left, there is a tall, green, narrow rectangle with a purple cross shape beside it. In the center of the image, there is a series of orange steps resembling stairs. On the right, there is a pink cross shape with a white square and a green vertical rectangular structure behind it.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are there any T-shaped pieces in either description?

This is my DESCRIPTION: The image shows several tetrominoes (four connected squares forming a geometric shape). There is one purple plus shape, three green T-shaped pieces, one orange L-shaped piece which is partially complete, and two pink pieces; one is upside-down T-shaped and the other is a single square.
QUESTION: Are there any T-shaped pieces in either description? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are there green pieces in your description that are not T-shaped?

ANSWER: Yes

Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are there any pink shapes besides the cross?

ANSWER: No

ANSWER: Orange

Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are any of the shapes overlapping in your image?

ANSWER: 2
QUESTION: Are any of the shapes overlapping in your image? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.

Now come to a decision. What do you think: are your picture and the other picture described the same picture?  Write "DECISION: same image" if you think they are the same picture or "DECISION: different images" if you think they are different pictures. Do not add anything else.
